title: Ofgem awards £58m to highly ambitious flexibility and hydrogen projects
lead: ​Ofgem has awarded up to £58 million to five projects designed to support the UK’s transition to net zero.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Utilita Energy condemns ‘grossly unfair’ Ofgem smart meter warning
lead: ​Utilita Energy has criticised Ofgem’s suggestion that it would take emergency measures if it fails to meet second generation smart meter targets, claiming it is ‘grossly unfair’.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UK carbon intensity from electricity more than halves but greater flexibility needed
lead: ​The UK’s electricity system has decarbonised twice as fast as any other major economy, according to a new report by Drax Electric Insights.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Siemens installs charging infrastructure for 37 electric London buses
lead: ​Charging infrastructure for 37 new electric buses has been installed at a West London depot by Siemens Smart Infrastructure.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Cornwall to rollout 150 new EV chargers with £2.9m funding
lead: ​Cornwall Council has secured £2.9 million in funding from the European Regional Development Fund to continue its electric vehicle (EV) charging rollout.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ofgem warns of new customer ban for Utilita Energy after it fails to rollout SMETS2 meters
lead: ​Ofgem has warned that it could stop utility Utilita Energy from taking on new customers unless it installs 15,000 second generation smart meters by 31 July 2021.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Arenko celebrates seven continuous weeks of delivering Dynamic Containment
lead: ​Arenko is lauding its position as the only company to have been successful in winning each of the daily auctions of National Grid ESO’s new Dynamic Containment service.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO warns of tight margins as power price set to surge beyond £300/MWh
lead: ​Low winds and falling temperatures have caused power prices to spike this evening (26 November), as National Grid ESO warns of tight margins.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Energy companies join call for stronger carbon pricing ahead of Brexit
lead: ​Companies from business, finance, academic and civil society have called on the UK government to commit to stronger and more consistent carbon pricing.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Elmtronics to 'step up' EV charging rollout with new £1.5m funding
lead: ​Electric vehicle charging firm Elmtronics has secured £1.5 million in funding to help drive its expansion.
author: Alice Grundy

title: BT teams up with Hubbub for smart home technology trial
lead: ​The Smarter Living Challenge has been launching by BT and Hubbub to explore how technology can reduce household carbon emissions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EDF continues energy storage push with PowerUp investment
lead: ​EDF has invested in cleantech startup PowerUp in a bid to support its 10GW of storage by 2035 ambitions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Infrastructure Strategy unveiled detailing 'ambitious' energy commitments
lead: Measures to improve the UK's green infrastructure - including the creation of a UK infrastructure bank, a ramping up of electric vehicle policy and funding for hydrogen and carbon capture and storage - have been detailed by the government.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Negative pricing extended in CfD rules as clarity on energy storage, renewables integration yet to come
lead: The government has confirmed that it will extend the negative pricing rule for projects bidding in next year’s Contracts for Difference (CfD) auction, but will further consult with the industry on potential amendments for energy storage and system flexibility.
author: Liam Stoker

title: Little energy funding highlighted in Sunak’s Spending Review
lead: ​Little was announced as part of this afternoon’s Spending Review that directly related to the energy sector, despite Chancellor Rishi Sunak stating that the government was "setting the direction" for green energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: COVID-19 could be a catalyst for a ‘greener, more sustainable future’ says Octopus Renewables
lead: ​As governments turn their eyes to a green recovery, 80% of institutional investors are planning to increase their investment into renewable energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Fast charging key to enabling European EV uptake
lead: ​Increasing European fast charging options would convince 66% of future electric vehicle (EV) drivers to switch sooner.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Bulb appoints new CFO to support 100 million members goal
lead: ​Bulb has unveiled the appointment of Paul Albin as its new chief financial officer as it looks to continue to expand.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Smart on-street EV charging project launched in ‘industry first’
lead: ​A project exploring smart on-street subsurface electric vehicle (EV) charging has been unveiled by Element Energy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Offshore wind commitments boost UK to top five in renewable attractiveness
lead: ​The UK has continued to climb EY’s Renewable Energy Country Attractiveness Index (RECAI), jumping up one place to fifth..
author: Alice Grundy
